intro: Dianthera appendiculata, commonly known as the appendiculate dianthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or violet. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces, and its stems are usually hairy as well. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Dianthera appendiculata is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
